meanings.definition: Correcting or eliminating astigmatism in a lens or optical system.
meanings.sent1: The optician worked on anastigmatic adjustments to improve the clarity of the lens.
meanings.sent2: She anastigmatically fine-tuned the camera lens for better focus.
meanings.sent3: The glasses were so anastigmatic after the repair that they made everything look crystal clear.
meanings.sent4: His skill in anastigmatic corrections turned the blurry images into sharp, detailed pictures.
meanings.sent5: The anastigmatic treatment transformed the distorted view into a sharp and clear image.

meanings.definition: A lens or optical system that is free from astigmatism.
meanings.sent1: The new telescope was an anastigmatic marvel, providing clear views of the stars.
meanings.sent2: Photographers prefer using anastigmatic lenses for their sharp and accurate images.
meanings.sent3: The anastigmatic binoculars made bird watching a delightful and clear experience.
meanings.sent4: Her vision through the anastigmatic glasses was like looking through a perfectly polished window.
meanings.sent5: The anastigmatic camera captured every detail with precision and clarity.
